intro: Taenitis furcata, commonly known as the forked taenitis, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Cyclanthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often deeply lobed, giving it a fern-like appearance. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with brightly colored, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
